result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Mosim

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED

- INCLUDES:  22CF580, 22CF311 and 22CF243 

- $1000.00 on file in 22CF311 and 22CF243 to remain on file. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- Defendant shall contact Kara Rheingans, Case Manager - Behavioral Health at 715-716-0920 within 48 hours. Ms. Rheingans shall conduct an intake screening to determine appropriateness for inclusion in programming offered by Behavioral Health. If you are screened in for services, you shall participate in programming as recommended. Failure to contact Ms. Rheingans or participate may be considered a violation of your bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:10 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Victor Mosim in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Victor Mosim. INCLUDES 20CT231, 22CF243, 22CF311 and 22CF580. Set for PLEAS. Court notes DE's positive test from JSC this morning. ADA Becker requests additional cash bond. Atty. Davis makes argument, DE has been in contact with treatment facility. Court will not accept DE's plea until he tests clean. Court modifies bond. DE is unable to post additional cash. Defendant remanded into custody. Court sets PLEAS with Branch II. Adjourned: 10:21 AM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:02 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Victor Mosim, Defendant Victor Mosim in court. INCLUDES 20CT231, 22CF243, 22CF311 and 22CF580. Set for PLEAS. Atty. Davis states there has been an offer extended. ADA Becker notes JSC report regarding DE's absconder status filed yesterday, requests additional cash bond. Atty. Davis responds, states DE attempted to call JSC, DE has assessment scheduled. Court responds, modifies bond to add additional cash. Atty. Davis states that DE is unable to post additional cash and is requesting to proceed with plea and sentencing today. RECESS. 1:19 PM - Case recalled. Appearances as previously noted. Atty. Davis is not comfortable proceeding to PLEAS today. Court modifies bond, DE to be tested upon going into custody. Court sets PLEAS. Court reinstates bond, DE to test at JSC today. Adjourned: 1:29 PM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

DE called re: pymt asking to make pymt on Mon. DE was advised that he's due to be issued a WA today b/c pymt was due on the 15th. DE stated he was unaware that pymt was due & can't get here to make pymt today, but clerk reminded DE that he inquired w/his atty's asst about this & was apparently aware that pymt was due. DE advised he'll need to submit a req to make pymt on 5/30 ASAP or he'll need to make the pymt by 1:00 today using the AP 24 hr pymt service. Includes 20CT231, 22CF243, 22CF311. jaf

Spoke w/Marcia from Atty Davis's Office re: Atty Fee PPlan. DE advised her he's having issues getting his mail & was unsure if pymt was only due for May. Marcia was advised that the DE is scheduled to be issued a FTP WA tomrw & that pymts are reoccuring by the 15th of ea mo. DE may stop in to get a copy of his PPA & pay the copy fee. Marcia stated she will email him a copy of the PPA for his records & advise him pymt must be pd immediately. Includes 20CT231, 22CF243, 22CF311. jaf
